commit.message:
Rollup merge of #50360 - kennytm:fix-50232-clarify-unstable-name-collision, r=nikomatsakis

Clarify wordings of the `unstable_name_collision` lint.

Stabilizing an inherent method may cause change in behavior instead of inference error. Updated to use the wording from [varkor's comment].

Closes #50232.

[varkor's comment]: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/50232#issuecomment-384678097

verification.payload:
tree ec441e0d00ee8644409745dbf9f3263769ebad1e
parent 73042c54f5b35cee1c9fce0167b99a1bdfff45a0
parent a78028d742e80002feca0be67a5f4f8ce183c82b
author kennytm <kennytm@gmail.com> 1525335090 +0800
committer kennytm <kennytm@gmail.com> 1525371167 +0800

Rollup merge of #50360 - kennytm:fix-50232-clarify-unstable-name-collision, r=nikomatsakis

Clarify wordings of the `unstable_name_collision` lint.

Stabilizing an inherent method may cause change in behavior instead of inference error. Updated to use the wording from [varkor's comment].

Closes #50232.

[varkor's comment]: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/50232#issuecomment-384678097

files.patch:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ LL |     assert_eq!('x'.ipu_flatten(), 1);
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: #[warn(unstable_name_collision)] on by default
-   = warning: once this method is added to the standard library, there will be ambiguity here, which will cause a hard error!
+   = warning: once this method is added to the standard library, the ambiguity may cause an error or change in behavior!
    = note: for more information, see issue #48919 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/48919>
    = help: call with fully qualified syntax `inference_unstable_itertools::IpuItertools::ipu_flatten(...)` to keep using the current method
    = note: add #![feature(ipu_flatten)] to the crate attributes to enable `inference_unstable_iterator::IpuIterator::ipu_flatten`
